props.synopsis: The National Library is asking for contributions to its election ephemera collection which it's been building since federation, collecting posters of former Prime Minister John Howard, flyers for Kevin ’07 and even how to vote cards from the early 1900s.

title.children: Election pamphlets may be 'annoying' but they tell a story of Australia

image.altText: Dutton looks serious, part of the frame is filled by the backs of reporters

props.synopsis: ACT politicians Andrew Leigh and David Pocock slam Peter Dutton's commitment today to cut 41,000 Canberra-based public service jobs.

title.children: 'Mathematical innumeracy': Dutton's commitment to cut Canberra public service slammed

image.altText: A woman in glasses holds her baby who wears a grey wiggles jumpsuit.

props.synopsis: The mother-of-two is among a growing number of people seeking out food relief for the first time, which includes families and people with stable jobs and mortgages.

title.children: Skylee turned to free food pantries to feed her family and she's far from alone

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: A woman with short white hair in a navy blue and white stripped button-down shirt stands on a footpath smiling.

props.synopsis: For Deb Stevens Burrangiri aged care respite facility in Canberra's south was a "lifeline" as her mother's dementia progressed, but the ACT's Health Minister says it's unlikely the facility will be the recipient of a promised $10 million federal funding boost should an Albanese government be re-elected.

title.children: Deb wants her 'lifeline' funded but the health minister say it's unlikely

image.altText: A woman in a paint-splattered button down shirt looks upward while painting on a canvas.

props.synopsis: With a canvas strapped to her back atop her bike, artist Sophie Baker cuts an unusual figure in the Canberra bush — now artists like her are ditching the studio to embrace painting in the open air as part of a new festival.

title.children: 'Into the bush': Artists ditch the studio to embrace open air painting

image.altText: Several veterans hold flags and walk in the street.

props.synopsis: Thousands of people have come together to mark Anzac Day across the country, 110 years after Australian and New Zealand soldiers landed on the Turkish coastline at Gallipoli.

title.children: 'I can't see it dwindling': Vietnam vet praises crowds at marches

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: Wests Tigers players jump on Adam Doueihi to celebrate an NRL win.

props.synopsis: Adam Doueihi slots a penalty goal in the second period of extra time to boot the Tigers to a 20-18 victory over Cronulla.

title.children: Marshall hails golden-point win as 'the pressure reliever we needed'

image.altText: Dutton McKenzie winery

props.synopsis: Bridget McKenzie says the Coalition believes in principle that electric vehicle drivers should pay a road use charge and will consider one in government, while insisting it will not be a "tax".

title.children: Coalition puts EV drivers on notice over road use tax

image.altText: A composite image of three women and a man

props.synopsis: The ABC revisited American voters from across the political spectrum about their thoughts and feelings almost 100 days into Trump's second term.

title.children: We met them before Trump 2.0. Here's what these Americans think now

image.altText: Three men wearing royal blue and yellow prison uniforms stand next to each other with their hands cuffed

props.synopsis: Football teammates from Utah become cellmates in a foreign prison after allegedly joining rebel forces in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title.children: How three young Americans allegedly conspired to overthrow a foreign government

image.altText: A silhouette of Lai, showing the damage to his limbs.

props.synopsis: It's been 50 years since the end of the war in Vietnam but an area "the size of Tasmania" is still grappling with unexploded bombs.

title.children: These explosives keep on killing 50 years after the Vietnam War

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy meet for the first time since their infamous February Oval Office stoush, amid protracted US-led attempts to broker a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine.

title.children: Trump meets Zelenskyy at pope's funeral, then blasts Putin on social media

image.altText: A sepia-tinged photo of a man holding a large crocodile.

props.synopsis: A crocodile wrangler from the country may sound like an unlikely advocate for LGBTQIA+ Australians in parliament. But Warren Entsch is just that — and it all started in a pub.

title.children: The out-of-the-blue reunion in a purple pub that changed Australia

image.altText: a man wearing army uniform speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's anti-corruption watchdog has been repeatedly photographed in full military regalia since taking on the $780,000 a year role.

title.children: Anti-corruption watchdog boss's defence links spark impartiality concerns

image.altText: Woman wearing red plaid shirt standing in covered patio.

props.synopsis: Can one partner meet all of our emotional and sexual needs? Meet the polyamorous Australians questioning relationship norms, and redefining what love and loyalty looks like.

title.children: Polyamory is becoming more common, but it can still carry stigma and shame

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Kylie Sanders was killed outside her Yarrawonga home after she tried to intervene in an argument, police say.

title.children: Police say woman died trying to help in neighbourhood fight

image.altText: A composite image shows US President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: As the world watches tariff brinkmanship unfold between the US and China, analysts cast doubt on the US president's claim that the Chinese leader called him.

title.children: Expert doubts Xi called Trump. Here's why

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit on a boat

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism officials are harking back to the 1980s with a campaign based on a cover of Madonna's hit Holiday to tempt people back to the state.

title.children: Queensland tourism campaign taps nostalgia with Madonna hit

image.altText: A gas flare with a line graph indicating gas prices

props.synopsis: Gas has been making lots of headlines throughout this election campaign. As we enter the final week, there are a few things to know about gas, how much of it we use, and what role it plays in our power bills.

title.children: We use very little gas, but it has an outsized effect on our bills

image.altText: Q+A/YouGov Poll 28 April 2025

props.synopsis: Most Australians believe the United States can no longer be relied on for security in a "fundamental change of worldview", research for Q+A shows.

title.children: 'Trump won't save us': Australians' radical shift on US relations

image.altText: A woman in bushland looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: Vaccine Nation is a warning about the acceleration of the anti-vaccination movement during the pandemic and worrying declines in vaccination rates around the world. Can we correct course before it's too late?

title.children: COVID jabs were a resounding success but vaccines now face a growing threat

image.altText: orange red and black smoke bellow from a port after an explosion

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for Iran's crisis management organisation said there had been prior warnings over the containment of the chemicals at the port.

title.children: Death toll rises after suspected chemical explosion at Iranian port

image.altText: Three young women performing a double dutch jump rope routine which includes a backflip.

props.synopsis: Most people know rope skipping as a playground activity, but for 12-year-olds Ella Pratley and Heath Malligan it's a highly competitive and technical sport they're preparing to represent Australia in on the world stage.

title.children: Canberra 12yos Heath and Ella are preparing to skip rope for Australia

image.altText: elon musk shrugs while standing in front of a seated donald trump in the oval office

props.synopsis: Experts say it could be too late for Tesla to "separate the man from the machine" as Elon Musk's personal brand hits an all-time low.

title.children: Musk has refocused on Tesla but experts say the 'rot has set in' already

image.altText: A white blonde woman sits next to an older man in a court room

props.synopsis: After a high-profile mistrial, the controversial case of Karen Read is back in court as her legal team continues to say she's being framed.

title.children: Karen Read says police killed her boyfriend. She's charged with his murder

image.altText: Older man with arm around woman holding stubby coolers, wearing hats, standing in front of back of tin house.

props.synopsis: As property prices continue to skyrocket across most of Australia, there are still pockets of cheap homes in regional communities.

title.children: Tiny town with properties under $100k keeps home ownership dream alive

image.altText: A series of ads for both liberal and labor party members, each represented respectively either by the colour blue or red.

props.synopsis: The federal election campaign battle on Chinese social media platforms has intensified, with a surge in candidates seeking to win over Chinese-Australian voters.

title.children: An intensifying election battle is unfolding on Chinese social media apps

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Looking for a chance to embarrass yourself? Today's your lucky day.

title.children: Like a quiz with a serving of sass? Come on in. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: crowds of people protest in tel aviv holding signs of the hostages faces who were taken by Hamas

props.synopsis: The families demand Benjamin Netanyahu end the war, saying if he refuses, they will "take action to topple him in order to save the hostages".

title.children: Families threaten to topple Netanyahu to 'save' Israeli hostages

image.altText: Minjee Lee in the follow through after playing a golf shot from the bunker

props.synopsis: Australian star Minjee Lee scored a timely birdie on the 18th hole of her third round at the first women's major of the year, keeping herself within reach of the leaders heading into the final round.

title.children: Late birdie keeps Lee in hunt for season's first golf major

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather handing out how-to-vote cards.

props.synopsis: After the Greens took over three new seats in Queensland's south-east in 2022, political analysts predicted the party was headed for a "surge" in popularity. But according to the polls, their primary vote is only marginally up from where it was three years ago.

title.children: 'They've done something wrong here': Greens seats in doubt after 2022's popularity surge

image.altText: Jeremy Crayshaw kicking a ball at an NFL combine.

props.synopsis: Following a stellar college career with the University of Florida, Jeremy Crawshaw is set to join the ranks of Australian punters in the NFL after being drafted by the Denver Broncos.

title.children: Aussie punter Crawshaw drafted by Denver Broncos

image.altText: A man gestures with his finger while speaking at a lectern in front of a banner reading PAP

props.synopsis: Singaporean law bars foreigners from publishing online election advertising, which it defines as online materials that could help or hurt any candidate.

title.children: Singapore orders Facebook to take down post by Australian
